channel.title: Npc's NoClip!
channel.description:
[quote="xx nub xx, post:1, topic:158157"]as many of you guys know... npcs are always in "noclip" mode.... meaning, you attack them from afar, and they walk through every building and object in their path to get to you.... also if you teleport or something while they are following you, they will just walk over the ocean and again, every building and object in their path until they reach you. i was wondering if there was a way to stop this, it would probably be in the boolean attackplayer, but im not even sure how you would do something like this because from what i believe, the concept of not being able to walk through walls is client side? and since npcs don't use a client (durr) i don't really see how this is possible.
if you have an idea... please post :)[/quote]
I found this question when searching and thought i would repeat it since it didnt have an answer... It would be gr8 if someone would help me with this!

item.title: Npc's NoClip!
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

[quote=“zoltanman, post:23, topic:192099”]It’s client sided on how players don’t walk through walls.

You have to treat your npcs as if they were players. Everything they do, walk, attack, etc…[/quote]

WOW, someone who didn’t read my novel posts. First, the client knows where the walls are. But for Npcs to not go through walls, and for the server to not let players who use ::noclip to go through walls, the server must have the information on what directions are walkable from a specific tile. The real RS server have this, that is why following, Npcs, and client hacks that allow ::noclip will not go through walls!

Read full topic

item.title: Npc's NoClip!
item.dc:creator: @zoltanman zoltanman
item.description:
@zoltanman wrote:

It’s client sided on how players don’t walk through walls.

You have to treat your npcs as if they were players. Everything they do, walk, attack, etc…

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Striker10777 Striker10777
item.description:
@Striker10777 wrote:

Thanks for your help…ill try this…let you know in about 2-3 years when i finnaly edit the client to make it work…

Read full topic

item.title: Npc's NoClip!
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

Write it to a text file would be the easiest way. Sending it to the server is not needed, the server will read it. The problem I’m thinking is how to get the X and Y cords of the tile, because the server will need that, and also the client only loads the walkable data for an area on Loading… please wait, because thats when noclip will reset. So, once you took care of generating the X any Y cords, you would need to walk around the entire map area.

But, since I’m smart, I would just set up a little something server-side that would teleport you one maparea at a time over the cords 0000,0000 through 9999,9999. So again, the only hard part would be generating the X and Y cords in the client and finding the data to export.

Now this is possible, and I am going to do this before I launch my new server, because PKing and Castle Wars where attacking players lets you follow them through walls would be no fun!

Read full topic

item.title: Npc's NoClip!
item.dc:creator: @Striker10777 Striker10777
item.description:
@Striker10777 wrote:

AAAH!! so download an open source client, (i have like 5) and get it to send the data that is needed to process to the server (or echo to batch)?

Read full topic

item.title: Npc's NoClip!
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

No, I mean get any client to export the data to a file or a database, then put in WITH the server’s files, and remove the exporting code from the client. Then, have the server read from the file or database. Then, no matter what client the person uses, it won’t let them go through walls. (Even if they did ::noclip)

Thats now it is on RS, but I have a hunch that the RS server has a copy of the cache with it. (Or it loads it from the Update Server)

Read full topic

item.title: Npc's NoClip!
item.dc:creator: @Striker10777 Striker10777
item.description:
@Striker10777 wrote:

Thanks…but it wouldnt work if someone were to use moparscape would it? i would have to use my own client that exports that particular data to the server…?

Read full topic

item.title: Npc's NoClip!
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

No, just get the client to export it once. Add it to the server, and no matter what client they use, you could prevent NPCs from going through walls, and players to, if you wanted to. (You could exclude Jagex Mods) That would make ::noclip make it so players could click anywhere, but they wouldn’t really go through the walls, like if you hack the real RS client and do ::noclip.

But to start, look at the client-side ::noclip command. It removes all the walls, so that would give away the variables that hold the values of walkable and non-walkable tiles.

Read full topic

item.title: Npc's NoClip!
item.dc:creator: @Striker10777 Striker10777
item.description:
@Striker10777 wrote:

That would be awesome, but wouldnt each client be different? or no?

Your right i probably could but my source sucks and i want to know if anyone has already made so atleast i can get an idea on how to make…because at the moment i have no FREAKING CLUE!![/quote]

Client-> exports data (hard part)
Server-> reads data. (Easy for me)

item.title: Npc's NoClip!
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

LeScape:

It is clientsided, and it has to do with the isInWorldMap boolean in npcHandler.java

Remember that these clients were actually used in Runescape.
If it were clientsided, it would already be added.
Therefore, I know it’s serverside.

Read full topic

item.title: Npc's NoClip!
item.dc:creator: @Striker10777 Striker10777

item.title: Npc's NoClip!
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

hah bah gee:

use silab server, and set coords, silab has created the void that you need, and if using silab client then they will not walk through stuff you set…

Wrong, wrong, and so wrong.

Striker10777:

Thats a client thing? Wouldnt npcs be a serverside command since npcs are on the server? i mean if they can walk through walls on one client and cant on the other doesnt that screw the whole point of it all?

NPC movement is SERVER-SIDE! It is SOOO obvious that the server sends the direction they move to the client, so obviously it is NOT client-side!!!

Also the rangeX and Y of an NPC are how far to let them walk, in a square. The ONLY WAY to fix this would be to somehow get the server to know what directions are walkable from a tile. This means it would have to load the data from the cache, or you would have to get the client to export it and get the server to read it.

Also, consider the following. Literally, consider following. (The Follow option on players)
I’ve created following on my server, and yes, it goes through walls also, because the server causes you to move in the direction of the the other player.

So again, you would HAVE TO make the server know what directions are walkable from any specified tile.

Read full topic
